channel.title: ASP.NET on Angelo Ryndon
channel.description: Recent content in ASP.NET on Angelo Ryndon

item.title: Learning ASP.NET Core
item.description: For the last few days, I‚Äôve started learning ASP.NET Core. After the initial research on how to build the UWP project for a client of mine, I think my idea of using ASP.NET Core Identity could actually work for this project. Since I don‚Äôt know how to use ASP.NET Core yet, I think I want to get comfortable with using it with a Web UI first before I go and build just an API using it. I‚Äôm currently watching a Pluralsight course about it by Scott Allen, I‚Äôll be writing down what I found different on ASP.NET Core compared to ASP.NET MVC to make the idea stick.

item.title: Researching on a UWP application for a client
item.description: Yesterday I started researching on a UWP application for a client of mine. This desktop app is supposed to save timesheets of current employees, and it lets them sign in and sign out of the workplace. The main purpose of this application is to save some paper.

item.title: ASP.NET Url rewrite module
item.description: I just received some feature requests from my client on this project.¬†The requests are about improving the site‚Äôs SEO rating. After adding the features, the site is now in the top 5 of google search results for ‚ÄúAuckland airport motel‚Äù. I used the rewrite module it to move the site to SSL.

item.title: Learning about ASP.NET MVC 5 Identity
item.description: I just watched a video from Scott Allen to learn more about MVC 5 Identity on ASP.NET. By the way the video is a great resource to get a grasp of the fundamentals of ASP.NET MVC 5. I‚Äôm primarily interested on Identity, OWIN and Katana because I just brushed through them quickly while working on a team project before. I should really start posting stuff I learned during the day or during the course of a week. I think in addition to writing code and building something, writing about it helps in making it stick üôÇ

item.title: Windows Azure configuration for ASP.NET MVC
item.description: The ASP.NET Web API convention annoyed me so much, well because I‚Äôm not proficient in Web API yet. By convention, your action name in Web API should match/contain the Http Verb name. I spent about 45 minutes trying to fix this thing! So now I hope I won‚Äôt forget that üôÇ
